N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.52 - Post-hearing briefs and proposed findings of fact; oral argument

State Regulations
(a) A party may
request at any time prior to conclusion of the hearing, or the Board or hearing
officer may direct the parties at any time, to submit written summations, briefs, or proposed findings of fact on any issue raised in the proceeding, or
for an oral argument on the record, or both. (b) The Board or hearing officer will fix the
schedule for post-hearing submissions after the hearing, or by written notice
to the parties upon receipt of the transcript of hearing. (c) If the Board or hearing officer requires
oral argument after submission of the parties' briefs, the Board will notify
the parties in writing of the time and place for argument. Notes
